publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3635 Frances Curran: Terminate Fizzy Drinks in Schools—That the Parliament is surprised to be congratulating free marketeer and Republican Governor of California, Arnold Schwarzenegger, who has banned fizzy drinks, including Coca-Cola, from all schools in California in an attempt to target childhood obesity; notes that the “Terminator” has terminated the sale of these drinks in schools in the same period that the Scottish Executive has been unable to decide what to do; further notes that Scotland is now lagging behind many countries which have also banned junk food and drink from their schools, and believes that decisive action on banning junk food and drink in schools cannot come soon enough in Scotland, where child obesity levels in Scotland have doubled in the last 10 years. Supported by: Carolyn Leckie*, Mark Ballard*
S2M-3635 Terminate Fizzy Drinks in Schools (lodged on 25 November 2005) Robin Harper*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-3635 Terminate Fizzy Drinks in Schools (lodged on 25 November 2005) Dr Jean Turner*, Christine Grahame*
S2M-3635 Terminate Fizzy Drinks in Schools (lodged on 25 November 2005) Rosie Kane*, John Swinburne*
S2M-3635 Terminate Fizzy Drinks in Schools (lodged on 25 November 2005) Mr Mark Ruskell*
S2M-3635 Terminate Fizzy Drinks in Schools (lodged on 25 November 2005) Chris Ballance*
S2M-3635 Terminate Fizzy Drinks in Schools (lodged on 25 November 2005) Elaine Smith*
